self.title: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)

datasetVariable.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariable.name: STUDYID

datasetVariable.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariable.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariable.name: DOMAIN

datasetVariable.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product. This must be a unique number, and could be a compound identifier formed by concatenating STUDYID-SITEID-SUBJID.
datasetVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariable.name: USUBJID

datasetVariable.description: Subject identifier, which must be unique within the study. Often the ID of the subject as recorded on a CRF.
datasetVariable.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
datasetVariable.name: SUBJID

datasetVariable.description: Reference Start Date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to date/time when subject was first exposed to study treatment. Required for all randomized subjects; will be null for all subjects who did not meet the milestone the date requires, such as screen failures or unassigned subjects.
datasetVariable.label: Subject Reference Start Date/Time
datasetVariable.name: RFSTDTC

datasetVariable.description: Reference End Date/time for the subject in ISO 8601 character format. Usually equivalent to the date/time when subject was determined to have ended the trial, and often equivalent to date/time of last exposure to study treatment. Required for all randomized subjects; null for screen failures or unassigned subjects.
datasetVariable.label: Subject Reference End Date/Time
datasetVariable.name: RFENDTC

datasetVariable.description: First date of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the earliest value of EXSTDTC.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of First Study Treatment
datasetVariable.name: RFXSTDTC

datasetVariable.description: Last date of exposure to any protocol-specified treatment or therapy, equal to the latest value of EXENDTC (or the latest value of EXSTDTC if EXENDTC was not collected or is missing).
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Last Study Treatment
datasetVariable.name: RFXENDTC

datasetVariable.description: Date/time of informed consent in ISO 8601 character format. This will be the same as the date of informed consent in the Disposition domain, if that protocol milestone is documented. Would be null only in studies not collecting the date of informed consent.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Informed Consent
datasetVariable.name: RFICDTC

datasetVariable.description: Date/time when subject ended participation or follow-up in a trial, as defined in the protocol, in ISO 8601 character format. Should correspond to the last known date of contact. Examples include completion date, withdrawal date, last follow-up, date recorded for lost to follow up, or death date.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of End of Participation
datasetVariable.name: RFPENDTC

datasetVariable.description: Date/time of death for any subject who died, in ISO 8601 format. Should represent the date/time that is captured in the clinical-trial database.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Death
datasetVariable.name: DTHDTC

datasetVariable.description: Indicates the subject died. Should be Y or null. Should be populated even when the death date is unknown.
datasetVariable.label: Subject Death Flag
datasetVariable.name: DTHFL

datasetVariable.description: Unique identifier for a site within a study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Site Identifier
datasetVariable.name: SITEID

datasetVariable.description: An identifier to describe the Investigator for the study. May be used in addition to SITEID. Not needed if SITEID is equivalent to INVID.
datasetVariable.label: Investigator Identifier
datasetVariable.name: INVID

datasetVariable.description: Name of the investigator for a site.
datasetVariable.label: Investigator Name
datasetVariable.name: INVNAM

datasetVariable.description: Date/time of birth of the subject.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Birth
datasetVariable.name: BRTHDTC

datasetVariable.description: Age expressed in AGEU. May be derived from RFSTDTC and BRTHDTC, but BRTHDTC may not be available in all cases (due to subject privacy concerns).
datasetVariable.label: Age
datasetVariable.name: AGE

datasetVariable.description: Units associated with AGE.
datasetVariable.label: Age Units
datasetVariable.name: AGEU

datasetVariable.description: Sex of the subject.
datasetVariable.label: Sex
datasetVariable.name: SEX

datasetVariable.description: Race of the subject. Sponsors should refer to "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, September 2005) for guidance regarding the collection of race (http://www.fda.gov/RegulatoryInformation/Guidances/ucm126340.htm) See Assumption below regarding RACE.
datasetVariable.label: Race
datasetVariable.name: RACE

datasetVariable.description: The ethnicity of the subject. Sponsors should refer to "Collection of Race and Ethnicity Data in Clinical Trials" (FDA, September 2005) for guidance regarding the collection of ethnicity (http://www.fda.gov/RegulatoryInformation/Guidances/ucm126340.htm).
datasetVariable.label: Ethnicity
datasetVariable.name: ETHNIC

datasetVariable.description: ARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ARMCD is longer than for other "short" variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials. For example, if ARMCD values for a seven-period crossover were constructed using two-character abbreviations for each treatment and separating hyphens, the length of ARMCD values would be 20.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Arm Code
datasetVariable.name: ARMCD

datasetVariable.description: Name of the Arm to which the subject was assigned.
datasetVariable.label: Description of Planned Arm
datasetVariable.name: ARM

datasetVariable.description: Code of actual Arm. When an Arm is not planned (not in Trial Arms), ACTARMCD will be UNPLAN. Randomized subjects who were not treated will be given a value of NOTTRT. Values should be "SCRNFAIL" for screen failures and "NOTASSGN" for subjects not assigned to treatment. Restricted to values in Trial Arms in all other cases. ACTARMCD is limited to 20 characters and does not have special character restrictions. The maximum length of ACTARMCD is longer than for other short variables to accommodate the kind of values that are likely to be needed for crossover trials.
datasetVariable.label: Actual Arm Code
datasetVariable.name: ACTARMCD

datasetVariable.description: Description of actual Arm. When an Arm is not planned (not in Trial Arms), ACTARM will be "Unplanned Treatment". Randomized subjects who were not treated will be given a value of "Not Treated". Values should be "Screen Failure" for screen failures and "Not Assigned" for subjects not assigned to treatment. Restricted to values in Trial Arms in all other cases.
datasetVariable.label: Description of Actual Arm
datasetVariable.name: ACTARM

datasetVariable.description: Country of the investigational site in which the subject participated in the trial.
datasetVariable.label: Country
datasetVariable.name: COUNTRY

datasetVariable.description: Date/time of demographic data collection.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Collection
datasetVariable.name: DMDTC

datasetVariable.description: Study day of collection measured as integer days.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of Collection
datasetVariable.name: DMDY

dataset.description: A special-purpose domain that includes a set of essential standard variables that describe each subject in a clinical study. It is the parent domain for all other observations for human clinical subjects. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49572, 2018-06-29)
dataset.label: Demographics
dataset.name: DM

class.description: This SDTM class contains a set of domains which do not conform to the Findings, Events or Interventions observation classes. The domains included are DM, CO, SE and SV. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103377, 2018-06-29)
class.label: Special-Purpose Datasets
class.name: Special-Purpose

datasetVariable.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariable.name: STUDYID

datasetVariable.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariable.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariable.name: DOMAIN

datasetVariable.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariable.name: USUBJID

datasetVariable.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariable.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariable.name: CMSEQ

datasetVariable.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariable.label: Group ID
datasetVariable.name: CMGRPID

datasetVariable.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Examples: a number pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: line number on a concomitant medication page.
datasetVariable.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariable.name: CMSPID

self.title: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy

datasetVariable.description: Verbatim medication name that is either pre-printed or collected on a CRF.
datasetVariable.label: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy
datasetVariable.name: CMTRT

datasetVariable.description: If CMTRT is modified to facilitate coding, then CMMODIFY will contain the modified text.
datasetVariable.label: Modified Reported Name
datasetVariable.name: CMMODIFY

datasetVariable.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived text description of CMTRT or CMMODIFY. Equivalent to the generic medication name in WHO Drug. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary then CMDECOD will be left blank.
datasetVariable.label: Standardized Medication Name
datasetVariable.name: CMDECOD

datasetVariable.description: Used to define a category of medications/treatments. Examples: PRIOR, CONCOMITANT, ANTI-CANCER MEDICATION, or GENERAL CONMED.
datasetVariable.label: Category for Medication
datasetVariable.name: CMCAT

datasetVariable.description: A further categorization of medications/ treatment. Examples: CHEMOTHERAPY, HORMONAL THERAPY, ALTERNATIVE THERAPY.
datasetVariable.label: Subcategory for Medication
datasetVariable.name: CMSCAT

datasetVariable.description: Used to indicate whether (Y/null) information about the use of a specific medication was solicited on the CRF.
datasetVariable.label: CM Pre-Specified
datasetVariable.name: CMPRESP

datasetVariable.description: When the use of specific medications is solicited, CMOCCUR is used to indicate whether or not (Y/N) use of the medication occurred. Values are null for medications not specifically solicited.
datasetVariable.label: CM Occurrence
datasetVariable.name: CMOCCUR

datasetVariable.description: Used to indicate that a question about a pre-specified medication was not answered. Should be null or have a value of NOT DONE.
datasetVariable.label: Completion Status
datasetVariable.name: CMSTAT

datasetVariable.description: Describes the reason concomitant medication was not collected. Used in conjunction with CMSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
datasetVariable.label: Reason Medication Not Collected
datasetVariable.name: CMREASND

datasetVariable.description: Denotes why a medication was taken or administered. Examples: NAUSEA, HYPERTENSION.
datasetVariable.label: Indication
datasetVariable.name: CMINDC

datasetVariable.description: Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class value. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4: 4.1.2.8.3, Multiple Values For A Non-Result Qualifier Variable or omit CMCLAS.
datasetVariable.label: Medication Class
datasetVariable.name: CMCLAS

datasetVariable.description: Class code corresponding to CMCLAS. Drug class. May be obtained from coding. When coding to a single class, populate with class code. If using a dictionary and coding to multiple classes, then follow Section 4: 4.1.2.8.3, Multiple Values For A Non-Result Qualifier Variable or omit CMCLASCD.
datasetVariable.label: Medication Class Code
datasetVariable.name: CMCLASCD

datasetVariable.description: Amount of CMTRT taken. Not populated when CMDOSTXT is populated.
datasetVariable.label: Dose per Administration
datasetVariable.name: CMDOSE

datasetVariable.description: Dosing amounts or a range of dosing information collected in text form. Units may be stored in CMDOSU. Example: 200-400, 15-20. Not populated when CMDOSE is populated.
datasetVariable.label: Dose Description
datasetVariable.name: CMDOSTXT

datasetVariable.description: Units for CMDOSE, CMDOSTOT, and CMDOSTXT. Examples: ng, mg, or mg/kg.
datasetVariable.label: Dose Units
datasetVariable.name: CMDOSU

datasetVariable.description: Dose form for CMTRT. Examples: TABLET, LOTION.
datasetVariable.label: Dose Form
datasetVariable.name: CMDOSFRM

datasetVariable.description: Usually expressed as the number of repeated administrations of CMDOSE within a specific time period. Examples: BID (twice daily), Q12H (every 12 hours).
datasetVariable.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
datasetVariable.name: CMDOSFRQ

datasetVariable.description: Total daily dose of CMTRT using the units in CMDOSU. Used when dosing is collected as Total Daily Dose. Total dose over a period other than day could be recorded in a separate Supplemental Qualifier variable.
datasetVariable.label: Total Daily Dose
datasetVariable.name: CMDOSTOT

datasetVariable.description: Text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the Intervention. Examples: TWO WEEKS ON, TWO WEEKS OFF.
datasetVariable.label: Intended Dose Regimen
datasetVariable.name: CMDOSRGM

datasetVariable.description: Route of administration for CMTRT. Examples: ORAL, INTRAVENOUS.
datasetVariable.label: Route of Administration
datasetVariable.name: CMROUTE

self.title: Study Day of Start of Medication

datasetVariable.description: Study day of start of medication relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of Start of Medication
datasetVariable.name: CMSTDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Medication

datasetVariable.description: Study day of end of medication relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of End of Medication
datasetVariable.name: CMENDY

datasetVariable.description: Collected duration for a treatment episode. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
datasetVariable.label: Duration of Medication
datasetVariable.name: CMDUR

datasetVariable.description: Describes the start of the medication relative to sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", ONGOING or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into CMSTRF.
datasetVariable.label: Start Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariable.name: CMSTRF

datasetVariable.description: Describes the end of the medication relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics). If information such as "PRIOR", "ONGOING, or "CONTINUING" was collected, this information may be translated into CMENRF.
datasetVariable.label: End Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariable.name: CMENRF

self.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariable.description: Identifies the start of the medication as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable CMSTTPT.
datasetVariable.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: CMSTRTPT

datasetVariable.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by CMSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
datasetVariable.label: Start Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: CMSTTPT

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariable.description: Identifies the end of the medication as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable CMENTPT.
datasetVariable.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: CMENRTPT

datasetVariable.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by CMENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
datasetVariable.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: CMENTPT

dataset.description: An interventions domain that contains concomitant and prior medications used by the subject, such as those given on an as needed basis or condition-appropriate medications. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49568, 2018-06-29)
dataset.label: Concomitant Medications
dataset.name: CM

datasetVariable.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariable.name: STUDYID

datasetVariable.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariable.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariable.name: DOMAIN

datasetVariable.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariable.name: USUBJID

datasetVariable.description: Sequence number to ensure uniqueness of records within a dataset for a subject. Should be assigned to be in a consistent chronological order.
datasetVariable.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariable.name: PRSEQ

datasetVariable.description: Used to link together a block of related records within a subject in a domain.
datasetVariable.label: Group ID
datasetVariable.name: PRGRPID

datasetVariable.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. Example: pre-printed line identifier on a CRF or record identifier defined in the sponsor's operational database.
datasetVariable.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariable.name: PRSPID

datasetVariable.description: Used to facilitate identification of relationships between records.
datasetVariable.label: Link ID
datasetVariable.name: PRLNKID

datasetVariable.description: Used to facilitate identification of relationships between records.
datasetVariable.label: Link Group ID
datasetVariable.name: PRLNKGRP

datasetVariable.description: Name of procedure performed, either pre-printed or collected on a CRF.
datasetVariable.label: Reported Name of Procedure
datasetVariable.name: PRTRT

datasetVariable.description: Standardized or dictionary-derived name of PRTRT. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms in the define.xml external codelist attributes. If an intervention term does not have a decode value in the dictionary then PRDECOD will be null.
datasetVariable.label: Standardized Procedure Name
datasetVariable.name: PRDECOD

datasetVariable.description: Used to define a category of procedure values.
datasetVariable.label: Category
datasetVariable.name: PRCAT

datasetVariable.description: Used to define a further categorization of PRCAT values.
datasetVariable.label: Subcategory
datasetVariable.name: PRSCAT

datasetVariable.description: Used when a specific procedure is pre-specified on a CRF. Values should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariable.label: Pre-specified
datasetVariable.name: PRPRESP

datasetVariable.description: Used to record whether a pre-specified procedure occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific procedure is solicited.
datasetVariable.label: Occurrence
datasetVariable.name: PROCCUR

datasetVariable.description: Denotes the indication for the procedure (e.g., why the procedure was performed).
datasetVariable.label: Indication
datasetVariable.name: PRINDC

datasetVariable.description: Amount of PRTRT administered. Not populated when PRDOSTXT is populated.
datasetVariable.label: Dose
datasetVariable.name: PRDOSE

datasetVariable.description: Dosing information collected in text form. Examples: <1, 200-400. Not populated when PRDOSE is populated.
datasetVariable.label: Dose Description
datasetVariable.name: PRDOSTXT

datasetVariable.description: Units for PRDOSE, PRDOSTOT, or PRDOSTXT.
datasetVariable.label: Dose Units
datasetVariable.name: PRDOSU

datasetVariable.description: Dose form for PRTRT.
datasetVariable.label: Dose Form
datasetVariable.name: PRDOSFRM

datasetVariable.description: Usually expressed as the number of doses given per a specific interval.
datasetVariable.label: Dosing Frequency per Interval
datasetVariable.name: PRDOSFRQ

datasetVariable.description: Text description of the intended schedule or regimen for the procedure.
datasetVariable.label: Intended Dose Regimen
datasetVariable.name: PRDOSRGM

datasetVariable.description: Route of administration for PRTRT.
datasetVariable.label: Route of Administration
datasetVariable.name: PRROUTE

datasetVariable.description: Anatomical location of a procedure.
datasetVariable.label: Location of Procedure
datasetVariable.name: PRLOC

datasetVariable.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality.
datasetVariable.label: Laterality
datasetVariable.name: PRLAT

datasetVariable.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing directionality.
datasetVariable.label: Directionality
datasetVariable.name: PRDIR

datasetVariable.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.
datasetVariable.label: Portion or Totality
datasetVariable.name: PRPORTOT

datasetVariable.description: Clinical encounter number. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariable.label: Visit Number
datasetVariable.name: VISITNUM

datasetVariable.description: Protocol-defined description of a clinical encounter.
datasetVariable.label: Visit Name
datasetVariable.name: VISIT

datasetVariable.description: Planned study day of VISIT. Should be an integer.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariable.name: VISITDY

datasetVariable.description: Start date/time of the procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariable.label: Start Date/Time of Procedure
datasetVariable.name: PRSTDTC

datasetVariable.description: End date/time of the procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariable.label: End Date/Time of Procedure
datasetVariable.name: PRENDTC

self.title: Study Day of Start of Procedure

datasetVariable.description: Study day of start of procedure expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of Start of Procedure
datasetVariable.name: PRSTDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Procedure

datasetVariable.description: Study day of end of procedure expressed in integer days relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC in Demographics.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of End of Procedure
datasetVariable.name: PRENDY

datasetVariable.description: Collected duration of a procedure represented in ISO 8601 character format. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times.
datasetVariable.label: Duration of Procedure
datasetVariable.name: PRDUR

datasetVariable.description: Text description of time when a procedure should be performed. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See PRTPTNUM and PRTPTREF.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariable.name: PRTPT

datasetVariable.description: Numerical version of planned time point used in sorting.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariable.name: PRTPTNUM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariable.description: Planned elapsed time in ISO 8601 format relative to a planned fixed reference (PRTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date/time variable, but an interval, represented as ISO duration.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariable.name: PRELTM

datasetVariable.description: Description of the fixed reference point referred to by PRELTM, PRTPTNUM, and PRTPT.
datasetVariable.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariable.name: PRTPTREF

datasetVariable.description: Date/time for a fixed reference time point defined by PRTRTREF in ISO 8601 character format.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: PRRFTDTC

self.title: Start Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariable.description: Identifies the start of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable PRSTTPT.
datasetVariable.label: Start Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: PRSTRTPT

datasetVariable.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by PRSTRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-15" or "VISIT 1".
datasetVariable.label: Start Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: PRSTTPT

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariable.description: Identifies the end of the observation as being before or after the sponsor-defined reference time point defined by variable PRENTPT.
datasetVariable.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: PRENRTPT

datasetVariable.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the sponsor-defined reference point referred to by PRENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
datasetVariable.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: PRENTPT

dataset.description: An interventions domain that contains interventional activity intended to have diagnostic, preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C102700, 2018-06-29)
dataset.label: Procedures
dataset.name: PR

class.description: This SDTM class captures investigational, therapeutic and other treatments that are administered to the subject (with some actual or expected physiological effect) either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure to study drug), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (such as use of alcohol, tobacco, or caffeine). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103374, 2018-06-29)
class.label: Interventions Observation Class
class.name: Interventions

datasetVariable.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariable.name: STUDYID

datasetVariable.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariable.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariable.name: DOMAIN

datasetVariable.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariable.name: USUBJID

datasetVariable.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariable.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariable.name: AESEQ

datasetVariable.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariable.label: Group ID
datasetVariable.name: AEGRPID

datasetVariable.description: Internal or external identifier such as a serial number on an SAE reporting form.
datasetVariable.label: Reference ID
datasetVariable.name: AEREFID

datasetVariable.description: Sponsor-defined identifier. It may be pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on an Adverse Events page.
datasetVariable.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariable.name: AESPID

self.title: Reported Term for the Adverse Event

datasetVariable.description: Verbatim name of the event.
datasetVariable.label: Reported Term for the Adverse Event
datasetVariable.name: AETERM

datasetVariable.description: If AETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then AEMODIFY will contain the modified text.
datasetVariable.label: Modified Reported Term
datasetVariable.name: AEMODIFY

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the Lowest Level Term.
datasetVariable.label: Lowest Level Term
datasetVariable.name: AELLT

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived code for the Lowest Level Term.
datasetVariable.label: Lowest Level Term Code
datasetVariable.name: AELLTCD

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived text description of AETERM or AEMODIFY. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes.
datasetVariable.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
datasetVariable.name: AEDECOD

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived code for the Preferred Term.
datasetVariable.label: Preferred Term Code
datasetVariable.name: AEPTCD

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the High Level Term for the primary System Organ Class.
datasetVariable.label: High Level Term
datasetVariable.name: AEHLT

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived code for the High Level Term for the primary System Organ Class.
datasetVariable.label: High Level Term Code
datasetVariable.name: AEHLTCD

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the High Level Group Term for the primary System Organ Class.
datasetVariable.label: High Level Group Term
datasetVariable.name: AEHLGT

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived code for the High Level Group Term for the primary System Organ Class.
datasetVariable.label: High Level Group Term Code
datasetVariable.name: AEHLGTCD

datasetVariable.description: Used to define a category of related records. Example: BLEEDING, NEUROPSYCHIATRIC.
datasetVariable.label: Category for Adverse Event
datasetVariable.name: AECAT

datasetVariable.description: A further categorization of adverse event. Example: NEUROLOGIC.
datasetVariable.label: Subcategory for Adverse Event
datasetVariable.name: AESCAT

datasetVariable.description: A value of "Y" indicates that this adverse event was pre-specified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms)
datasetVariable.label: Pre-Specified Adverse Event
datasetVariable.name: AEPRESP

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary derived. Body system or organ class used by the sponsor from the coding dictionary (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.
datasetVariable.label: Body System or Organ Class
datasetVariable.name: AEBODSYS

self.title: Body System or Organ Class Code

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary derived. Code for the body system or organ class used by the sponsor. When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables, which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.
datasetVariable.label: Body System or Organ Class Code
datasetVariable.name: AEBDSYCD

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived text description of the primary System Organ Class. Will be the same as AEBODSYS if the primary SOC was used for analysis.
datasetVariable.label: Primary System Organ Class
datasetVariable.name: AESOC

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived code for the primary System Organ Class. Will be the same as AEBDSYCD if the primary SOC was used for analysis.
datasetVariable.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
datasetVariable.name: AESOCCD

datasetVariable.description: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event (e.g., ARM for skin rash).
datasetVariable.label: Location of Event
datasetVariable.name: AELOC

datasetVariable.description: The severity or intensity of the event. Examples: MILD, MODERATE, SEVERE.
datasetVariable.label: Severity/Intensity
datasetVariable.name: AESEV

datasetVariable.description: Is this a serious event?
datasetVariable.label: Serious Event
datasetVariable.name: AESER

datasetVariable.description: Describes changes to the study treatment as a result of the event. AEACN is specifically for the relationship to study treatment. AEACNOTH is for actions unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Examples of AEACN values include ICH E2B values: DRUG WITHDRAWN, DOSE REDUCED, DOSE INCREASED, DOSE NOT CHANGED, UNKNOWN or NOT APPLICABLE.
datasetVariable.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
datasetVariable.name: AEACN

datasetVariable.description: Describes other actions taken as a result of the event that are unrelated to dose adjustments of study treatment. Usually reported as free text. Example: "TREATMENT UNBLINDED. PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN NOTIFIED."
datasetVariable.label: Other Action Taken
datasetVariable.name: AEACNOTH

datasetVariable.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event to the treatment. ICH E2A and E2B examples include NOT RELATED, UNLIKELY RELATED, POSSIBLY RELATED, RELATED. Controlled Terminology may be defined in the future. Check with regulatory authority for population of this variable.
datasetVariable.label: Causality
datasetVariable.name: AEREL

datasetVariable.description: Records the investigator's opinion as to whether the event may have been due to a treatment other than study drug. May be reported as free text. Example: "MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE.".
datasetVariable.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
datasetVariable.name: AERELNST

datasetVariable.description: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time. Examples: INTERMITTENT, CONTINUOUS, SINGLE EVENT.
datasetVariable.label: Pattern of Adverse Event
datasetVariable.name: AEPATT

datasetVariable.description: Description of the outcome of an event.
datasetVariable.label: Outcome of Adverse Event
datasetVariable.name: AEOUT

datasetVariable.description: Was the serious event associated with the development of cancer?
datasetVariable.label: Involves Cancer
datasetVariable.name: AESCAN

datasetVariable.description: Was the serious event associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect?
datasetVariable.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
datasetVariable.name: AESCONG

datasetVariable.description: Did the serious event result in persistent or significant disability/incapacity?
datasetVariable.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
datasetVariable.name: AESDISAB

datasetVariable.description: Did the serious event result in death?
datasetVariable.label: Results in Death
datasetVariable.name: AESDTH

datasetVariable.description: Did the serious event require or prolong hospitalization?
datasetVariable.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
datasetVariable.name: AESHOSP

datasetVariable.description: Was the serious event life threatening?
datasetVariable.label: Is Life Threatening
datasetVariable.name: AESLIFE

datasetVariable.description: Did the serious event occur with an overdose?
datasetVariable.label: Occurred with Overdose
datasetVariable.name: AESOD

datasetVariable.description: Do additional categories for seriousness apply?
datasetVariable.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
datasetVariable.name: AESMIE

datasetVariable.description: Was another treatment given because of the occurrence of the event?
datasetVariable.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
datasetVariable.name: AECONTRT

datasetVariable.description: Toxicity grade according to a standard toxicity scale such as Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v3.0 (CTCAE). Sponsor should specify name of the scale and version used in the metadata (see Assumption 6d). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2" and not "Grade 2").
datasetVariable.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
datasetVariable.name: AETOXGR

self.title: Study Day of Start of Adverse Event

datasetVariable.description: Study day of start of adverse event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of Start of Adverse Event
datasetVariable.name: AESTDY

self.title: Study Day of End of Adverse Event

datasetVariable.description: Study day of end of event relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of End of Adverse Event
datasetVariable.name: AEENDY

datasetVariable.description: Collected duration and unit of an adverse event. Used only if collected on the CRF and not derived from start and end date/times. Example: P1DT2H (for 1 day, 2 hours).
datasetVariable.label: Duration of Adverse Event
datasetVariable.name: AEDUR

datasetVariable.description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point (RFSTDTC) and a discrete ending point (RFENDTC) of the trial.
datasetVariable.label: End Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariable.name: AEENRF

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariable.description: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable AEENTPT.
datasetVariable.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: AEENRTPT

datasetVariable.description: Description of date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by AEENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
datasetVariable.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: AEENTPT

dataset.description: An events domain that contains data describing untoward medical occurrences in a patient or subjects that are administered a pharmaceutical product and which may not necessarily have a causal relationship with the treatment. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49562, 2018-06-29)
dataset.label: Adverse Events
dataset.name: AE

datasetVariable.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariable.name: STUDYID

datasetVariable.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariable.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariable.name: DOMAIN

datasetVariable.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariable.name: USUBJID

datasetVariable.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariable.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariable.name: MHSEQ

datasetVariable.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariable.label: Group ID
datasetVariable.name: MHGRPID

datasetVariable.description: Internal or external medical history identifier.
datasetVariable.label: Reference ID
datasetVariable.name: MHREFID

datasetVariable.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on a Medical History page.
datasetVariable.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariable.name: MHSPID

self.title: Reported Term for the Medical History

datasetVariable.description: Verbatim or preprinted CRF term for the medical condition or event.
datasetVariable.label: Reported Term for the Medical History
datasetVariable.name: MHTERM

datasetVariable.description: If MHTERM is modified to facilitate coding, then MHMODIFY will contain the modified text.
datasetVariable.label: Modified Reported Term
datasetVariable.name: MHMODIFY

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived text description of MHTERM or MHMODIFY. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes.
datasetVariable.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
datasetVariable.name: MHDECOD

datasetVariable.description: Used to define a category of related records. Examples: CARDIAC or GENERAL
datasetVariable.label: Category for Medical History
datasetVariable.name: MHCAT

datasetVariable.description: A further categorization of the condition or event.
datasetVariable.label: Subcategory for Medical History
datasetVariable.name: MHSCAT

datasetVariable.description: A value of "Y" indicates that this medical history event was pre-specified on the CRF. Values are null for spontaneously reported events (i.e., those collected as free-text verbatim terms)
datasetVariable.label: Medical History Event Pre-Specified
datasetVariable.name: MHPRESP

datasetVariable.description: Used when the occurrence of specific medical history conditions is solicited to indicate whether or not (Y/N) a medical condition (MHTERM) had ever occurred. Values are null for spontaneously reported events.
datasetVariable.label: Medical History Occurrence
datasetVariable.name: MHOCCUR

datasetVariable.description: The status indicates that the pre-specified question was not asked/answered.
datasetVariable.label: Completion Status
datasetVariable.name: MHSTAT

self.title: Reason Medical History Not Done or Not Occurred

datasetVariable.description: Reason the question was not asked/answered or an intervention did not occur. Used in conjunction with negation indicators --STAT of 'NOT DONE' or --OCCUR of 'N'
datasetVariable.label: Reason Medical History Not Done or Not Occurred
datasetVariable.name: MHREASND

datasetVariable.description: Dictionary-derived. Body system or organ class that is involved in an event or measurement from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA). When using a multi-axial dictionary such as MedDRA, this should contain the SOC used for the sponsor's analyses and summary tables which may not necessarily be the primary SOC.
datasetVariable.label: Body System or Organ Class
datasetVariable.name: MHBODSYS

self.title: Start Date/Time of Medical History Event

datasetVariable.label: Start Date/Time of Medical History Event
datasetVariable.name: MHSTDTC

self.title: End Date/Time of Medical History Event

datasetVariable.label: End Date/Time of Medical History Event
datasetVariable.name: MHENDTC

datasetVariable.description: 1. Study day of medical history collection, measured as integer days. 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of History Collection
datasetVariable.name: MHDY

datasetVariable.description: Describes the end of the event relative to the sponsor-defined reference period. The sponsor-defined reference period is a continuous period of time defined by a discrete starting point and a discrete ending point (represented by RFSTDTC and RFENDTC in Demographics)
datasetVariable.label: End Relative to Reference Period
datasetVariable.name: MHENRF

self.title: End Relative to Reference Time Point

datasetVariable.description: Identifies the end of the event as being before or after the reference time point defined by variable MHENTPT.
datasetVariable.label: End Relative to Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: MHENRTPT

datasetVariable.description: Description or date/time in ISO 8601 character format of the reference point referred to by MHENRTPT. Examples: "2003-12-25" or "VISIT 2".
datasetVariable.label: End Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: MHENTPT

dataset.description: An events domain that contains data that includes the subject's prior medical history at the start of the trial. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49603, 2018-06-29)
dataset.label: Medical History
dataset.name: MH

class.description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103372, 2018-06-29)
class.label: Events Observation Class
class.name: Events

datasetVariable.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariable.name: STUDYID

datasetVariable.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariable.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariable.name: DOMAIN

datasetVariable.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariable.name: USUBJID

datasetVariable.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariable.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariable.name: LBSEQ

datasetVariable.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariable.label: Group ID
datasetVariable.name: LBGRPID

datasetVariable.description: Internal or external specimen identifier. Example: Specimen ID.
datasetVariable.label: Specimen ID
datasetVariable.name: LBREFID

datasetVariable.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database. Example: Line number on the Lab page.
datasetVariable.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariable.name: LBSPID

self.title: Lab Test or Examination Short Name

datasetVariable.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in LBTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in LBTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g."1TEST"). LBTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: ALT, LDH.
datasetVariable.label: Lab Test or Examination Short Name
datasetVariable.name: LBTESTCD

datasetVariable.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Note any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test. The value in LBTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Alanine Aminotransferase, Lactate Dehydrogenase.
datasetVariable.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
datasetVariable.name: LBTEST

datasetVariable.description: Used to define a category of related records across subjects. Examples: such as HEMATOLOGY, URINALYSIS, CHEMISTRY.
datasetVariable.label: Category for Lab Test
datasetVariable.name: LBCAT

datasetVariable.description: A further categorization of a test category such as DIFFERENTIAL, COAGULATON, LIVER FUNCTION, ELECTROLYTES.
datasetVariable.label: Subcategory for Lab Test
datasetVariable.name: LBSCAT

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariable.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
datasetVariable.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariable.name: LBORRES

datasetVariable.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for LBORRES. Example: g/L.
datasetVariable.label: Original Units
datasetVariable.name: LBORRESU

self.title: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit

datasetVariable.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
datasetVariable.label: Reference Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
datasetVariable.name: LBORNRLO

self.title: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit

datasetVariable.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in original units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
datasetVariable.label: Reference Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
datasetVariable.name: LBORNRHI

datasetVariable.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from LBORRES in a standard format or standard units. LBSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in LBSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in LBORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in LBSTRESC as "NEGATIVE". For other examples, see general assumptions.
datasetVariable.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariable.name: LBSTRESC

datasetVariable.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from LBSTRESC. LBSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariable.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariable.name: LBSTRESN

datasetVariable.description: Standardized unit used for LBSTRESC or LBSTRESN.
datasetVariable.label: Standard Units
datasetVariable.name: LBSTRESU

datasetVariable.description: Lower end of reference range for continuous measurements for LBSTRESC/LBSTRESN in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
datasetVariable.label: Reference Range Lower Limit-Std Units
datasetVariable.name: LBSTNRLO

datasetVariable.description: Upper end of reference range for continuous measurements in standardized units. Should be populated only for continuous results.
datasetVariable.label: Reference Range Upper Limit-Std Units
datasetVariable.name: LBSTNRHI

self.title: Reference Range for Char Rslt-Std Units

datasetVariable.description: For normal range values that are character in ordinal scale or if categorical ranges were supplied (e.g., "-1 to +1", "NEGATIVE TO TRACE").
datasetVariable.label: Reference Range for Char Rslt-Std Units
datasetVariable.name: LBSTNRC

datasetVariable.description: 1. Indicates where the value falls with respect to reference range defined by LBORNRLO and LBORNRHI, LBSTNRLO and LBSTNRHI, or by LBSTNRC. Examples: NORMAL, ABNORMAL, HIGH, LOW. 2. Sponsors should specify in the study metadata (Comments column in the define.xml) whether LBNRIND refers to the original or standard reference ranges and results. 3. Should not be used to indicate clinical significance.
datasetVariable.label: Reference Range Indicator
datasetVariable.name: LBNRIND

datasetVariable.description: Used to indicate exam not done. Should be null if a result exists in LBORRES.
datasetVariable.label: Completion Status
datasetVariable.name: LBSTAT

datasetVariable.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed such as BROKEN EQUIPMENT, SUBJECT REFUSED, or SPECIMEN LOST. Used in conjunction with LBSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
datasetVariable.label: Reason Test Not Done
datasetVariable.name: LBREASND

datasetVariable.description: The name or identifier of the laboratory that performed the test.
datasetVariable.label: Vendor Name
datasetVariable.name: LBNAM

datasetVariable.description: 1. Dictionary-derived LOINC Code for LBTEST. 2. The sponsor is expected to provide the dictionary name and version used to map the terms utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes
datasetVariable.label: LOINC Code
datasetVariable.name: LBLOINC

datasetVariable.description: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement. Examples: SERUM, PLASMA, URINE.
datasetVariable.label: Specimen Type
datasetVariable.name: LBSPEC

datasetVariable.description: Free or standardized text describing the condition of the specimen e.g. HEMOLYZED, ICTERIC, LIPEMIC etc.
datasetVariable.label: Specimen Condition
datasetVariable.name: LBSPCCND

datasetVariable.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: EIA (Enzyme Immunoassay), ELECTROPHORESIS, DIPSTICK
datasetVariable.label: Method of Test or Examination
datasetVariable.name: LBMETHOD

datasetVariable.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariable.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariable.name: LBBLFL

datasetVariable.description: Indicator used to identify fasting status such as Y, N, U, or null if not relevant.
datasetVariable.label: Fasting Status
datasetVariable.name: LBFAST

datasetVariable.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null. Records that represent the average of other records, or do not come from the CRF, or are not as originally received or collected are examples of records that might be derived for the submission datasets. If LBDRVFL=Y, then LBORRES may be null, with LBSTRESC, and (if numeric) LBSTRESN having the derived value.
datasetVariable.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariable.name: LBDRVFL

datasetVariable.description: Description of toxicity quantified by LBTOXGR. The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes.
datasetVariable.label: Toxicity
datasetVariable.name: LBTOX

datasetVariable.description: Records toxicity grade value using a standard toxicity scale (such as the NCI CTCAE). If value is from a numeric scale, represent only the number (e.g., "2" and not "Grade 2"). The sponsor is expected to provide the name of the scale and version used to map the terms, utilizing the define.xml external codelist attributes.
datasetVariable.label: Standard Toxicity Grade
datasetVariable.name: LBTOXGR

datasetVariable.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariable.label: Visit Number
datasetVariable.name: VISITNUM

datasetVariable.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY
datasetVariable.label: Visit Name
datasetVariable.name: VISIT

datasetVariable.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariable.name: VISITDY

datasetVariable.description: 1. Study day of specimen collection, measured as integer days. 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics. This formula should be consistent across the submission.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of Specimen Collection
datasetVariable.name: LBDY

datasetVariable.description: 1. Text Description of time when specimen should be taken. 2. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See LBTPTNUM and LBTPTREF. Examples: Start, 5 min post.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariable.name: LBTPT

datasetVariable.description: Numerical version of LBTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariable.name: LBTPTNUM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariable.description: Planned Elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (LBTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by LBTPTREF.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariable.name: LBELTM

datasetVariable.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by LBELTM, LBTPTNUM, and LBTPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.
datasetVariable.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariable.name: LBTPTREF

datasetVariable.description: Date/time of the reference time point, LBTPTREF.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: LBRFTDTC

dataset.description: A findings domain that contains laboratory test data such as hematology, clinical chemistry and urinalysis. This domain does not include microbiology or pharmacokinetic data, which are stored in separate domains. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49592, 2018-06-29)
dataset.label: Labs
dataset.name: LB

datasetVariable.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariable.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariable.name: STUDYID

datasetVariable.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariable.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariable.name: DOMAIN

datasetVariable.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all applications or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariable.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariable.name: USUBJID

datasetVariable.description: Sequence Number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariable.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariable.name: VSSEQ

datasetVariable.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject.
datasetVariable.label: Group ID
datasetVariable.name: VSGRPID

datasetVariable.description: Sponsor-defined reference number. Perhaps pre-printed on the CRF as an explicit line identifier or defined in the sponsor's operational database.
datasetVariable.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariable.name: VSSPID

datasetVariable.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in VSTEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in VSTESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g."1TEST"). VSTESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: SYSBP, DIABP, BMI.
datasetVariable.label: Vital Signs Test Short Name
datasetVariable.name: VSTESTCD

datasetVariable.description: Verbatim name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. The value in VSTEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Systolic Blood Pressure, Diastolic Blood Pressure, Body Mass Index.
datasetVariable.label: Vital Signs Test Name
datasetVariable.name: VSTEST

datasetVariable.description: Used to define a category of related records.
datasetVariable.label: Category for Vital Signs
datasetVariable.name: VSCAT

datasetVariable.description: A further categorization of a measurement or examination.
datasetVariable.label: Subcategory for Vital Signs
datasetVariable.name: VSSCAT

datasetVariable.description: Position of the subject during a measurement or examination. Examples: SUPINE, STANDING, SITTING.
datasetVariable.label: Vital Signs Position of Subject
datasetVariable.name: VSPOS

self.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

datasetVariable.description: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
datasetVariable.label: Result or Finding in Original Units
datasetVariable.name: VSORRES

datasetVariable.description: Original units in which the data were collected. The unit for VSORRES. Examples: IN, LB, BEATS/MIN.
datasetVariable.label: Original Units
datasetVariable.name: VSORRESU

datasetVariable.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from VSORRES in a standard format or standard units. VSSTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in VSSTRESN. For example, if a test has results "NONE", "NEG", and "NEGATIVE" in VSORRES and these results effectively have the same meaning, they could be represented in standard format in VSSTRESC as "NEGATIVE".
datasetVariable.label: Character Result/Finding in Std Format
datasetVariable.name: VSSTRESC

datasetVariable.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; copied in numeric format from VSSTRESC. VSSTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariable.label: Numeric Result/Finding in Standard Units
datasetVariable.name: VSSTRESN

datasetVariable.description: Standardized unit used for VSSTRESC and VSSTRESN.
datasetVariable.label: Standard Units
datasetVariable.name: VSSTRESU

datasetVariable.description: Used to indicate that a vital sign measurement was not done. Should be null if a result exists in VSORRES.
datasetVariable.label: Completion Status
datasetVariable.name: VSSTAT

datasetVariable.description: Describes why a measurement or test was not performed. Examples: BROKEN EQUIPMENT or SUBJECT REFUSED. Used in conjunction with VSSTAT when value is NOT DONE.
datasetVariable.label: Reason Not Performed
datasetVariable.name: VSREASND

datasetVariable.description: Location relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement. Example: ARM for blood pressure.
datasetVariable.label: Location of Vital Signs Measurement
datasetVariable.name: VSLOC

datasetVariable.description: Qualifier for anatomical location or specimen further detailing laterality. Examples: RIGHT, LEFT, BILATERAL
datasetVariable.label: Laterality
datasetVariable.name: VSLAT

datasetVariable.description: Indicator used to identify a baseline value. The value should be "Y" or null.
datasetVariable.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariable.name: VSBLFL

datasetVariable.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null. Records which represent the average of other records or which do not come from the CRF are examples of records that would be derived for the submission datasets. If VSDRVFL=Y, then VSORRES may be null, with VSSTRESC and (if numeric) VSSTRESN having the derived value.
datasetVariable.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariable.name: VSDRVFL

datasetVariable.description: 1. Clinical encounter number. 2. Numeric version of VISIT, used for sorting.
datasetVariable.label: Visit Number
datasetVariable.name: VISITNUM

datasetVariable.description: 1. Protocol-defined description of clinical encounter. 2. May be used in addition to VISITNUM and/or VISITDY.
datasetVariable.label: Visit Name
datasetVariable.name: VISIT

datasetVariable.description: Planned study day of the visit based upon RFSTDTC in Demographics.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Study Day of Visit
datasetVariable.name: VISITDY

datasetVariable.description: 1. Study day of vital signs measurements, measured as integer days. 2. Algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in Demographics.
datasetVariable.label: Study Day of Vital Signs
datasetVariable.name: VSDY

datasetVariable.description: 1. Text Description of time when measurement should be taken. 2. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See VSTPTNUM and VSTPTREF. Examples: Start, 5 min post
datasetVariable.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariable.name: VSTPT

datasetVariable.description: Numerical version of VSTPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariable.name: VSTPTNUM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariable.description: Planned Elapsed time (in ISO 8601) relative to a planned fixed reference (VSTPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 Duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by VSTPTREF.
datasetVariable.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariable.name: VSELTM

datasetVariable.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by VSELTM, VSTPTNUM, and VSTPT. Examples: PREVIOUS DOSE, PREVIOUS MEAL.
datasetVariable.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariable.name: VSTPTREF

datasetVariable.description: Date/time of the reference time point, LBTPTREF.
datasetVariable.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariable.name: VSRFTDTC

dataset.description: A findings domain that contains measurements including but not limited to blood pressure, temperature, respiration, body surface area, body mass index, height and weight. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, DOMAIN, C49622, 2018-06-29)
dataset.label: Vital Signs
dataset.name: VS

class.description: This SDTM class captures the observations resulting from planned evaluations to address specific tests or questions such as laboratory tests, ECG testing, and questions listed on questionnaires. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, C103373, 2018-06-29)
class.label: Findings Observation Class
class.name: Findings

product.description: CDISC Version 3.2 (V3.2) Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials (SDTMIG) is intended to guide the organization, structure, and format of standard clinical trial tabulation datasets submitted to a regulatory authority such as the US Food and Drug Administration (FDA).
product.label: Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide: Human Clinical Trials Version 3.2 (Final)
product.name: SDTMIG v3.2
product.source: Prepared by the CDISC Submission Data Standards Team
